channel.title: Whats a good website to use for a server forums?
channel.description: I have about 40$ to spend on a website and I want to have it so its mine all the way, no smfforfree sites that put their own ads on them. I want to be able to have ads from Google absence on it and be able to edit it fully and add in a web client and such. Any recommendations?

item.title: Whats a good website to use for a server forums?
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:10, topic:375148”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=471111.msg3445502#msg3445502 date=1293403027]

how do you host yr domain on your vps :(?
[/quote]You install apache, run it, buy a domain, and link it to your IP :o

Would you be able to run a server and a website off the same vps/dedi? or would you have to have 2?[/quote]You can run it off the same one. I had an IRC server, webserver, and a few other things running on mine. So it should be more than capable.

Read full topic
item.source: Whats a good website to use for a server forums?

Would you be able to run a server and a website off the same vps/dedi? or would you have to have 2?[/quote]You should be able to use them on the same.

item.title: Whats a good website to use for a server forums?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Evil_, post:5, topic:375148”]I’d just buy a VPS (I bought one from x10vps) and install lighttpd/apache. That way you can own the website yourself, plus host your server on it.[/quote]This. I hosted my server & webserver on the same computer. Then just buy a domain cheap

Read full topic
item.source: Whats a good website to use for a server forums?

item.title: Whats a good website to use for a server forums?
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

I’d just buy a VPS (I bought one from x10vps) and install lighttpd/apache. That way you can own the website yourself, plus host your server on it.

Read full topic
